problem_text:
Let F be a free group of rank 2.
a) It is known that scl(g) = 0 only for g = 1, and scl(g) ⩾ 1/2 for all 1 ̸= g ∈ [F, F]. Is 1/2 an isolated value?
b) Are there any intervals J in R such that the set of values of scl on [F, F] is dense in J?
c) Is there some T ∈ R such that every rational number ⩾ T is a value of scl(g) for g ∈ [F, F]?
D. Calegari
